title: Defining the Role and Function of IETF Protocol Parameter Registry Operators
abstract:
Many Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) protocols make use of commonly
defined values that are passed in messages or packets.  To ensure consistent
interpretation of these values between independent implementations, there is a
need to ensure that the values and associated semantic intent are uniquely
defined.  The IETF uses registry functions to record assigned
protocol parameter values and their associated semantic intentions.  For
each IETF protocol parameter, it is current practice for the IETF to
delegate the role of Protocol Parameter Registry Operator to a
nominated entity.  This document provides a description of, and the
requirements for, these delegated functions.  This document is not an 
Internet Standards Track specification; it is published for informational 
purposes.
